intro: Symplocos phanerophlebia, commonly known as the showy wax myrtle, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves that turn red in the fall. The plant produces small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring. Its fruits are small, bright red berries that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. Symplocos phanerophlebia thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
